<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

## Description {#details}

This callback is used in conjunction with PointerMayBeCaptured.

In addition to the interface here, you&#39;ll need to provide your own getters to see whether anything was captured.

Definition at line 83 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/capturetracking-h">CaptureTracking.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### captured() {#ae3425ae1022a2f2713b0047bb12a468d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual bool llvm::CaptureTracker::captured (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> &#42; U)</>}>
captured - Information about the pointer was captured by the user of use U.

Return true to stop the traversal or false to continue looking for more capturing instructions.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/capturetracking-h/#l00100">100</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/capturetracking-h">CaptureTracking.h</a>.

### isDereferenceableOrNull() {#a684899edefe864cb9411de38e995986c}

<MemberDefinition

  labels = {["virtual"]}>
isDereferenceableOrNull - Overload to allow clients with additional knowledge about pointer dereferenceability to provide it and thereby avoid conservative responses when a pointer is compared to null.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/capturetracking-h/#l00105">105</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/capturetracking-h">CaptureTracking.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/capturetracking-cpp/#l00059">59</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/capturetracking-cpp">CaptureTracking.cpp</a>.

### shouldExplore() {#a14c74061cc326f6b674c5b11c2e8420f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CaptureTracker::shouldExplore (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> &#42; U)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
shouldExplore - This is the use of a value derived from the pointer.

To prune the search (ie., assume that none of its users could possibly capture) return false. To search it, return true.

U-&gt;getUser() is always an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/capturetracking-h/#l00095">95</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/capturetracking-h">CaptureTracking.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/capturetracking-cpp/#l00057">57</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/capturetracking-cpp">CaptureTracking.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### tooManyUses() {#a736d928ff83259d1318e7f3bd079cfa8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="virtual void llvm::CaptureTracker::tooManyUses ()">
tooManyUses - The depth of traversal has breached a limit.

There may be capturing instructions that will not be passed into <a href="#ae3425ae1022a2f2713b0047bb12a468d">captured()</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/capturetracking-h/#l00088">88</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/capturetracking-h">CaptureTracking.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
